object.property: ['Device', 'WebLogic Core', 'WebLogic JCA', 'WebLogic JMS', 'WebLogic JMS Destination', 'WebLogic JTA', 'WebLogic JTA Rollbacks', 'WebLogic JVM', 'WebLogic Thread Pool', 'WebLogic Timer Service', 'WebLogic User Lockouts']
Return the total number of restarts for this server since the cluster was last activated.
Return the current number sockets registered for socket muxing on this server.
Return the total number of registrations for socket muxing on this sever.
Returns the number of resource adapters that are active.
Returns the number of connection pools in all active RAs.
Returns an array of runtime information for all deployed and active resource adapters.
Returns the number of resource adapter connection pools that have been created since server start up.
The number of requests that have been processed
The number of waiting requests in the queue.
The number of thread that are considers stuck on the basis of any stuck thread constraints.
The total number of connections made to this WebLogic Server since the last reset.
The total number of JMS servers that were deployed on this WebLogic Server instance since this server was started.
Note: Make sure you update the object name in each data source to reflect your domain, server, and queue name.
Note: Make sure you update the object name in each data source to reflect your domain, server, and queue name.
The current number of bytes stored in the destination.

object.id: WLS JMS Destination Bytes Pageable Current Count

object.property: Return the total number of bytes in all the messages that are currently available to be paged out, but which have not yet been paged out.

object.id: WLS JMS Destination Bytes Paged In

object.property: Return the total number of bytes that were read from the paging directory since the JMS server was started.

object.id: WLS JMS Destination Bytes Paged Out

object.property: Return the total number of bytes that were written to the paging directory since the JMS server was started.
The number of pending bytes stored in the destination.
The number of bytes received in this destination since the last reset.

object.id: WLS JMS Destination Bytes Threshold Time

object.property: The amount of time in the threshold condition since the last reset.
The current number of destinations for this JMS server.
The total number of destinations for this JMS server.
The current number of messages in the destination.

object.id: WLS JMS Destination Message Pageable Count

object.property: Return the number of messages that are currently available for paging in this JMS server but have not yet been paged out.

object.id: WLS JMS Destination Messages Paged In

object.property: Return the total number of messages that were read from the paging directory since the JMS server was started.

object.id: WLS JMS Destination Messages Paged Out

object.property: Return the total number of messages that were written to the paging directory since the JMS server was started.

object.id: WLS JMS Destination Messages Pending Count

object.property: The current number of messages pending (unacknowledged or uncommitted) stored on this JMS server.
The number of messages received on this destination since the last reset.

object.id: WLS JMS Destination Messages Threshold Time

object.property: The amount of time in the threshold condition since the last reset.
WLS JMS Destination Messages Paged In_MessagesPagedInTotalCount
WLS JMS Destination Messages Paged Out_MessagesPagedOutTotalCount
WLS JMS Destination Messages Pending Count_MessagesPendingCount
WLS JMS Destination Bytes Paged In_BytesPagedInTotalCount
WLS JMS Destination Bytes Paged Out_BytesPagedOutTotalCount
The total number of transactions that were abandoned since the server was started.
The number of active transactions on the server.
The total number of transactions committed since the server was started.
The number of transactions that completed with a heuristic status since the server was started.
The number of transactions that were rolled back since the server was started.
The number of transactions that were rolled back due to a timeout expiration.
The total number of seconds that transactions were active for all committed transactions.
The total number of transactions processed. This total includes all committed, rolled back, and heuristic transaction completions since the server was started.
The number of transactions that were rolled back due to an application error.
The number of transactions that were rolled back due to a resource error
The number of transactions that were rolled back due to an internal system error.
Returns the total number of collections that have occurred.
Returns the approximate accumulated collection elapsed time in milliseconds.
Returns the current number of live daemon threads.
Returns the amount of free physical memory in bytes.
Returns the current memory usage of the heap that is used for object allocation.
Returns the total number of collections that have occurred.
Returns the approximate accumulated collection elapsed time in milliseconds.
Returns the current memory usage of non-heap memory that is used by the Java virtual machine
The number of completed requests in the priority queue.
The total number of threads in the pool.
The number of idle threads in the pool.
The number of pending requests in the priority queue.
The mean number of requests completed per second
The number of times an exception type has been thrown since enabling exception counting. If exception counting has not been enabled for the specified type, the result is unspecified.
Return the number of already executed statements.
Return the number of executed statements per minute.
Make sure you update the realm name in the data sources
Make sure you update the realm name in the data sources

Returns the number of invalid logins attempted since this server has been started and lockouts have been enabled. In a cluster, this method returns the number of invalid logins attempted that have occured since the cluster has been started because all servers share login failure information.
Returns the number of invalid logins attempted since this server has been started and lockouts have been enabled.
Returns the number of users that are currently locked out of this server.
Returns the number times users have been unlocked since this server has been started.

The number of user lockouts that have occured since this server has been started. In a cluster, this method returns the number of user lockouts that have occured since the cluster has been started because all servers share login failure information.
Return the current number of connections to JDBC datasource.
Return the total number of connections to JDBC datasource.
Return the number of leaked connections to JDBC datasource.
Return the number of requests waiting for connection to JDBC datasource.
Return the number of requests waiting for connection to JDBC datasource.
